intro: Aerva brachiata var. multiflora, commonly known as the Indian mallow or multiflora mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Aerva brachiata var. multiflora is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional systems of medicine.
